extendedIngredients.name: tilapia fillets
extendedIngredients.original: 24 ozs tilapia fillets (4 fillets, 6 oz each)

title: Panko Tilapia
summary: Panko Tilapia might be a good recipe to expand your main course repertoire. This dairy free and pescatarian recipe serves 1 and costs $13.2 per serving. One serving contains 1495 calories, 152g of protein, and 75g of fat. If you have panko, flour, lemon-pepper seasoning, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the egg you could follow this main course with the Rose Levy Beranbaum's Chocolate Tomato Cake with Mystery Ganache as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 15 minutes. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. Overall, this recipe earns an amazing spoonacular score of 83%. Try Panko Encrusted Tilapia Fillets, Panko Crusted Tilapia with a Fresh Tomato Basil Sauce + Giveaway, and Tilapian in Mushroom Sauce (Tilapian en Salsa de Champiñones) for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Anne Amie Pinot Gris with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Anne Amie Pinot Gris
productMatches.description:
Aromas of Bartlett pear, gardenia, white peach, white tea, jasmine, graham cracker, and straw. Flavors of Asian pear, white fig, white peach, white strawberry, and fennel flowers. The finish is dry, long and acid driven.
Pairs well with roast chicken, Caesar salad, mussels, quince glazed pork chop, grilled squash, pan seared trout, and bibimbap.

instructions: On plate, mix flour and seasoning.On second plate, place bread crumbs.In bowl, beat egg with fork.Coat fish with flour, dip into egg and coat well with bread crumbs.In 10-inch nonstick skillet, heat 2 Tbsp of the oil over medium-high heat. Add 2 fish fillets and cook 3 minutes.Carefully turn fish over. Reduce heat to medium and cook about 3 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily with fork.Repeat for remaining 2 fillets.

steps.step: On plate, mix flour and seasoning.On second plate, place bread crumbs.In bowl, beat egg with fork.Coat fish with flour, dip into egg and coat well with bread crumbs.In 10-inch nonstick skillet, heat 2 Tbsp of the oil over medium-high heat.
Add 2 fish fillets and cook 3 minutes.Carefully turn fish over. Reduce heat to medium and cook about 3 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily with fork.Repeat for remaining 2 fillets.
